security_audit.summary: Legitimate frontend build tool for creating Claude.ai artifacts. Scripts initialize React projects, install npm packages via standard package managers, and bundle code into self-contained HTML. All static findings are false positives: license URLs are legitimate, shell commands are standard build tooling, and cryptographic alerts are triggered by version numbers and legal text, not actual crypto usage.

content.user_title: Build powerful React artifacts for Claude
content.value_statement: Creating complex interactive artifacts for Claude.ai requires modern frontend tooling. This skill sets up a complete React development environment with shadcn/ui components and bundles everything into a single HTML file ready to share in conversations.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + Vite project with TypeScript
Install and configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui theming
Configure path aliases for clean imports
Bundle React app into single self-contained HTML file
Support dark mode and CSS variables theming
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher on your system
Not for simple single-file HTML or JSX artifacts
Cannot create artifacts requiring server-side code

best_practices: Use shadcn/ui components consistently for a cohesive look across artifacts
Test artifacts in browser before sharing to catch rendering issues
Keep artifacts focused on a single purpose rather than trying to do too much
anti_patterns: Do not use this for simple HTML snippets that could be written directly
Avoid excessive animations or visual effects that slow down the artifact
Do not include external CDN links - bundle everything locally

faq.question: Does this work with Claude Free?
faq.answer: Yes. The bundled HTML files work in any Claude plan. Only Claude Code uses the skill itself.

faq.question: What is the maximum artifact size?
faq.answer: Artifacts have no strict limit but smaller files load faster. Keep under 500KB for best performance.

faq.question: Can I use external APIs in artifacts?
faq.answer: Yes, but ensure CORS is enabled on the API. Client-side calls work if the server allows cross-origin requests.

faq.question: Is my data safe when building artifacts?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers during build.

faq.question: Why is my artifact not rendering correctly?
faq.answer: Check browser console for errors. Ensure all dependencies are bundled. Avoid server-side features like Node.js modules.

faq.question: How is this different from writing artifacts directly?
faq.answer: This enables complex state, routing, and 40+ pre-built components. Best for multi-view apps, not simple static content.
